info.game_comments:
James Holzhauer game 33. 
Emma Boettcher game 1.
Emma Boettcher ends James's streak before he can break Ken Jennings's cash winnings total record.

(1, 1).clue: For an optimistic view of things, take a look through these

(2, 1).clue: Melville's "Bartleby the Scrivener" is subtitled "A Story of" this street of finance

(3, 1).clue: Ahoy!  It's a lookout perch atop a high mast

(5, 1).clue: "The American people don't believe anything's real until they see it" here

(6, 1).clue: I'm not a cook, but I can sure toast up these Kellogg company breakfast treats with the best of them

(1, 2).clue: If you have these, it means you're well-organized

(2, 2).clue: In a 1923 book by Kahlil Gibran, Almustafa is this mystical title character

(3, 2).clue: Made in a series of varying sizes to fit one inside each other, matryoshka are "nesting" these from Russia

(5, 2).clue: Of his 1972 trip to this country, Nixon echoed the famous line "We came in peace for all mankind"

(6, 2).clue: I hum one of his country songs as I pop one of his protein-packed breakfast bowls into the microwave

(2, 3).clue: In "Charlotte's Web", Templeton is this creature

(3, 3).clue: The creature that provides the marquee ingredient of this Chinese delicacy is endangered

(5, 3).clue: In a 1960 debate Nixon said this man "has asked for my advice... Sometimes my advice has been taken.  Sometimes it has not"

(6, 3).clue: I can't bake or mash a potato, so this alliterative Ore-Ida spud product that dates back to 1953 is a godsend to me

(1, 4).clue: Greenhouse gas emission due to human activity leaves behind this

(2, 4).clue: In a novel Simone de Beauvoir depicted herself as Anne & this author of "The Stranger" as Henri

(3, 4).clue: Danny DeVito & Christopher Lloyd both had small parts as mental hospital inmates in this 1975 film
(3, 4).correct response: One Flew Over the Cuckoo\'s Nest

(5, 4).clue: In 1969 Nixon asked for the support of a "silent majority of my fellow Americans" in regard to this foreign affairs issue

(6, 4).clue: I'm a wizard at breakfast with this cereal that now features a new marshmallow shaped like a magical unicorn

(1, 5).clue: Note the lovely weather; it means to take advantage of an opportunity
(1, 5).correct response: make hay while the sun shines

(2, 5).clue: The title peak of this Thomas Mann novel is home to a Swiss sanatorium

(3, 5).clue: Doesn't sound comfy, but several birds make nests in the giant saguaro cactus, including the Gila variety of this headbanger

(5, 5).clue: In his 1977 interviews with this British journalist, Richard Nixon said, "I have impeached myself"

(6, 5).clue: You don't want vegetables cooked by me--have them raw, as this French-named appetizer

(1, 1).clue: Add "La Vella" to the name of this Pyrenees country to get the full name of its capital

(2, 1).clue: This triangular object can make a mini-rainbow because different colors in light travel at different speeds in it

(3, 1).clue: Paternalism is restricting freedom in our (supposed) best interests, like state taxes on these, which began in Iowa in 1921

(4, 1).clue: The premiere of this Netflix series sees Philip renounce his foreign titles & agree to a new one, Duke of Edinburgh

(5, 1).clue: Lithuanian Sarunas Marciulionis was the first Soviet in this League when he joined the Warriors

(6, 1).clue: Proponents of this type of diet say cooking kills nutrients

(1, 2).clue: It's home to the annual United States Sailboat Show

(2, 2).clue: (Mad?) scientists tried to make a frost-resistant tomato by adding a modified one of these taken from an Arctic flounder

(3, 2).clue: Remove 2 letters from "equality" to get this, the idea of giving remedies to the less fortunate to ensure equality

(4, 2).clue: This History Channel show finds the title Northerners raiding Paris, which did happen back in the day

(5, 2).clue: In 2010 Gori, Georgia took down a statue honoring this once favorite son & moved it into a museum

(6, 2).clue: It describes a management style where everything flows from the boss, or perhaps a ride in a convertible

(1, 3).clue: In 1664 the English changed its name from Beverwyck to this to honor James, Duke of it

(2, 3).clue: New solar & wind farms could bring this to the north of Africa, just like the song from Toto says

(3, 3).clue: Samuel Pufendorf, he's your friend when things get rough & in 1673 said a nation needs this document; the USA's founders listened

(4, 3).clue: Horror aside, "The Terror" tells of the HMS Terror, a real ship searching for this seafaring route

(5, 3).clue: This man is born in Riga, Latvia in 1898--cut to him directing "Battleship Potemkin" less than 30 years later

(6, 3).clue: This style of design marked by geometric motifs & streamlined forms was all the rage in the 1920s & 1930s

(1, 4).clue: Called City of Churches, this capital of South Australia has the country's oldest Catholic cathedral

(2, 4).clue: Some scientists think more than 95% of the universe is made up of what's called this "energy" & this "matter"

(3, 4).clue: St. Augustine's "City of God" asks, without this quality of fairness, "What are kingdoms but great bands of robbers?"

(4, 4).clue: Wyatt & Morgan Earp showed up on this HBO series & Wyatt told Seth Bullock of his lawman days in Dodge City

(5, 4).clue: Chess master Garry Kasparov's first move was made in Baku, now in this country

(6, 4).clue: A groaner from this family member--hey, what did the grape do when stepped on? It let out a little wine

(1, 5).clue: The Dutch colonized this national capital in the 17th century, but the Dutch were Ghana by 1872

(2, 5).clue: Nerve cells in your body have axons that are covered by what is called this sheath

(3, 5).clue: On book covers from GOP lawmakers Jason Chaffetz & Mike Lee is this phrase for the bureaucracy said to be working against democracy

(5, 5).clue: This Ukranian-born composer created "Peter and the Wolf"

(6, 5).clue: This powerful type of adhesive is often dispensed with a gun

(0, 0).clue: The line "a great reckoning in a little room" in "As You Like It" is usually taken to refer to this author's premature death
